item.title: Nebraska's $11-million Question
item.description: After a 1-16 Big Ten season record, there was chatter around Nebraska regarding the job security of one of the state’s highest-paid employees. Everyone and their brother were talking about whether Nebraska men’s basketball head coach, Fred Hoiberg, should come back for another year. There were $18.5 million reasons for him to stay, but public pressure and a not so pretty track record led to a restructured contract that reduced Hoiberg’s buyout to only $11 million.
